research.title: Why Do AI Models Drink Water?
research.subtitle: Generating text requires massive energy, which creates massive heat.

compute_heat.title: 1. Compute Heat
compute_heat.text: GPUs run at 100% capacity to process billions of parameters. This friction generates extreme temperatures, similar to a car engine revving.

evaporative_cooling.title: 2. Evaporative Cooling
evaporative_cooling.text: To prevent melting, Data Centers use water-based cooling towers. Water is evaporated to remove heat, consuming clean water in the process.

power_generation.title: 3. Power Generation
power_generation.text: The electricity powering the servers also consumes water at the source (hydroelectric, nuclear, or coal steam turbines), adding hidden costs.

perspective.label: Perspective
perspective.title: What is 50 Queries?
perspective.text: Writing a long essay or coding session with GPT-4 (approx. 50 turns) consumes roughly the same amount of water as a standard 16oz (500ml) water bottle.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions & Research Data

q1.q: How much water does ChatGPT consume per query?
q1.a: Recent research from UC Riverside and Cornell University indicates that a typical conversation of 20-50 queries with GPT-4 can consume roughly 500ml of water. This AI water footprint varies significantly based on the model complexity (GPT-4 vs GPT-3.5), the location of the data center, and the local Power Usage Effectiveness (PUE) of the cooling infrastructure.

q2.q: Why do data centers need water for AI?
q2.a: Training and running Large Language Models (LLMs) generates massive thermal energy. To prevent hardware failure, data centers use evaporative cooling towers. This process dissipates heat by evaporating clean water into the atmosphere. Additionally, the electricity generation required to power these GPUs carries a significant indirect water footprint at the source.

q3.q: What is the environmental impact of Large Language Models (LLMs)?
q3.a: Beyond electricity consumption, the physical cost of Green AI is measured in water scarcity and carbon output. As data center water usage 2026 projections show exponential growth, initiatives like Waterbuss aim to provide transparency into the Sustainable computing metrics required for responsible AI deployment and global resource management.

methodology.p1: Estimates are based on the industry standard of 500ml water consumption per 20-50 queries (varying by model efficiency and cooling tech).
